alright, just calm down. i dont have a chip implanted in my head that alerts me to an email whenever i get one and i had gone when you sent the last one.



right, heres where were at. i got an email back from the courier company and this is a copy and paste of what they said. ive put in bold the important bits.

Dear Sir,







Thank you for your email, I have checked your tracking number and see that there is a "shipment exception", that is concerning an incorrect insurance certificate, it seems that you have undervalued the item you sent to Nigeria, that means that the insurance certificates are incorrect and therefore invalid. this puts us in a very difficult position. you asked me for 700 for a plane ticket but im completely strapped for money since i sent such a large amount with the PC and wont get payed until the 30th of this month. my company wont allow an advance paycheck either since were only allowed two of those a year and i took mine in febuary and june. im sorry, i cant pay for the plane ticket.



i will however be able to pay for you to drive over there. if you borrow some money for petrol and other things, ill refund you the money when you get to cameroon and ive received my paycheck. since i feel quite bad about this, ill also pay £2 for every 3 kilometres you add to the cars mileage. this should cover just about all the expenses.

alright, just calm down. i dont have a chip implanted in my head that alerts me to an email whenever i get one and i had gone when you sent the last one.
right, heres where were at. i got an email back from the courier company and this is a copy and paste of what they said. ive put in bold the important bits.
________________
Dear Sir,

Thank you for your email, I have checked your tracking number and see that there is a "shipment exception", that is concerning an incorrect insurance certificate, it seems that you have undervalued the item you sent to Nigeria, that means that the insurance certificates are incorrect and therefore invalid. When this happens, we offload the shipped items as we are not covered by insurance to carry it if it has been undervalued.

New insurance certificates cannot be issued once a package has departed, this means your shipment of a Desktop PC was offloaded at Douala International Airport (DLA) in Cameroon, it cannot travel any further, it cannot be returned for you to send it again due to us not being able to issue new insurance certificates for it, also, as we are contracted by you, no other couriers are allowed to deliver it, the receiver, Mr Uyi Iyamu, will need to collect the Desktop PC from the customs office at Douala Airport, there are no excess charges for him to pay.

I must also inform you that we have a 10 day collection rule, if the Desktop PC is not collected by the receiver, Mr Uyi Iyamu, within 10 days from the date they arrived in Cameroon, today October 17th, then the Desktop PC will be sold to the highest bidder at public auction to pay for the demurrage for storage of the item.

Regards,


______________
this puts us in a very difficult position. you asked me for 700 for a plane ticket but im completely strapped for money since i sent such a large amount with the PC and wont get payed until the 30th of this month. my company wont allow an advance paycheck either since were only allowed two of those a year and i took mine in febuary and june. im sorry, i cant pay for the plane ticket.
i will however be able to pay for you to drive over there. if you borrow some money for petrol and other things, ill refund you the money when you get to cameroon and ive received my paycheck. since i feel quite bad about this, ill also pay £2 for every 3 kilometres you add to the cars mileage. this should cover just about all the expenses.
i know it does sound like much of a consolation but its the best i can offer.
terry
